Description: Torso of alabaster male figure (kouros). Left leg slightly advanced. Arms at side. Torso and upper thighs, broken at neck and knee. The torso is slim, strongly reduced above the onset of the thighs. The underbelly is slightly protruding and is drawn in around the waistline. The inguinal ligament almost reaches the sides; the buttocks is small and rounded. The thighs are long and slender, their cross-section is oval; the outline of the left thigh is almost straight on the back. No remains of paint. The surface is very damaged with dirt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Höckmann 2007 / Zyprisch-griechische Kleinplastik: Kouroi, andere Figuren und plastisch verzierte Gefässe (no. N 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.100) (Phase 3)
